description: Japan’s Nippon Steel Corp. defended its proposed $14.1 billion acquisition of United States Steel Corp. after President Joe Biden earlier in the day said the company should retain American ownership.
title: Nippon Steel Defends US Deal After Biden Comes Out Against Bid

description: President Javier Milei’s initial dose of shock therapy teeters on the edge of collapse after Argentina’s senate defeated his sweeping executive decree in a 42-to-25 vote Thursday.
title: Milei’s Decree Suffers Major Setback After Repeal in Senate

description: Former President Donald Trump lost his bid to have charges that he mishandled classified documents dropped on grounds that they’re too vague.
title: Trump Loses Bid to Get Judge to Toss Classified Records Charges

description: A group of House Republicans are demanding that the US use its influence to replace the head of the International Monetary Fund over alleged mismanagement, citing reports of ethical breaches and inability to hold China accountable for its lending and currency practices.
title: House Republicans Urge Yellen to Push Replacing IMF Chief

description: Russia’s longest-serving leader since Stalin is all but certain to win another term as president this weekend just as the war in Ukraine turns in his favor.
title: Putin Digs In to Divide World Order While He Conquers at Home

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, senior Washington correspondent Saleha Mohsin discusses on her podcast how the Federal Reserve is being dragged into the 2024 campaign debate. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Presidential Campaign Sticks Powell Between Policy and Politics

description: The Biden administration sanctioned two Israeli settlements in the West Bank on Thursday and called on the country to do more to end violence against Palestinians there, as tensions continue between the two governments over the war in the Gaza Strip.
title: US Sanctions Israel’s West Bank Settlers as Gaza Tensions Grow

description: French President Emmanuel Macron warned that the European Union would face an “existential” threat of a Russian invasion unless Vladimir Putin’s forces are defeated in Ukraine.
title: Macron Warns Europe Will Be Next If Russia Wins in Ukraine

description: RedBird IMI is considering a sale of the Telegraph after Rishi Sunak’s government said it is working to ban foreign state ownership of UK media titles.
title: RedBird Considers Telegraph Sale as UK Targets Foreign State Ownership

description: Republican Senators Marco Rubio and Rick Scott of Florida are urging the Biden administration to designate Venezuela’s Tren de Aragua as a transnational criminal organization in a new effort to curb the gang’s alleged expansion into the US.
title: Lawmakers Urge Biden to Label Venezuela Gang as Criminals

description: Money-market fund assets rose to a fresh record high on expectations short-term rates will remain elevated for longer after traders reined in bets on the first Federal Reserve cuts this year.
title: Money-Market Assets Rise to Fresh Record for Third Straight Week

description: House Republicans are ramping up work on their own Ukraine package, and the idea of seizing Russian assets to pay for billions in war aid is gaining traction within the party.
title: House Republicans Look to Frozen Russian Assets to Fund Ukraine

description: Senators from both sides of the aisle swatted down the idea of fast-tracking legislation that would force TikTok’s Chinese owner to sell the video-sharing app within six months, reducing its prospects of becoming law.
title: TikTok Ban-or-Divest Bill Is Going Nowhere Fast in Senate

description: Prime Minister Rishi Sunak ruled out a UK general election on May 2, signaling that a public vote would take place later this year instead.
title: Sunak Rules Out May 2 UK Election, Vote Likely Later in Year

description: Palestinian Authority President Mahmoud Abbas appointed the chairman of the Palestine Investment Fund to form a new government that will seek to rebuild the Gaza Strip when the Israel-Hamas war ends, according to his office.
title: Abbas Names Palestine Investment Fund Chief to Form Government

description: France’s lower house of parliament approved government-backed legislation that seeks to impose penalties and other restrictions on fast-fashion because of its associated environmental harm.
title: French Bill Clamping Down on Fast-Fashion Clears First Hurdle

description: The US has introduced a resolution at the United Nations promoting “safe, secure and trustworthy” artificial intelligence systems, an effort to align global regulations intended to address legal, national security and human rights concerns over the technology’s rapid expansion.
title: US Pushes for Global AI Regulations at UN

description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s Bharatiya Janata Party received nearly half of the political donations through electoral bonds over the past five years, according to data released by the nation’s elections watchdog weeks before national polls.
title: Modi’s Party Was Biggest Beneficiary of Now-Banned Electoral Bonds

description: Latvian Prime Minister Evika Silina said a failure to support Ukraine and a Russian victory in the conflict will have a global impact, including the US.
title: A Russian Victory in Ukraine Would Affect US, Latvian Premier Says

description: The US dollar would be poised to rally 3% if former President Donald Trump is re-elected in November based on his policy proposals for more tariffs, economic stimulus and a weaker commitment to NATO, according to foreign-exchange strategists at Barclays Plc.
title: Second Trump Term Would Spark a 3% Dollar Rally, Barclays Says

description: Argentine President Javier Milei circulated a new, trimmed version of his reform package to the country’s governors in a bid to win their support before he resubmits it to congress.
title: Milei Sends Scaled-Back Reform Bill to Argentina’s Governors

description: New York City Comptroller Brad Lander has been a vocal advocate for more affordable housing in the city.
title: NYC’s $264 Billion Pensions Fail to Invest More in Affordable Housing

description: Geert Wilders and his coalition rivals have agreed to discuss a form of government where the party leaders remain in parliament but don’t join the cabinet, a day after the far-right lawmaker abandoned his bid to become Dutch prime minister.
title: Wilders Won’t Become Dutch Premier But Can Still Be Kingmaker

description: Poland’s nationalist opposition is making a last-ditch effort to block a contested probe of the central bank governor that parliament may open as soon as next week.
title: Polish Opposition Asks Court to Block Central Bank Chief Probe

description: China’s ambassador says the country will continue to do business in Canada’s domestic critical minerals sector despite Prime Minister Justin Trudeau’s “unfortunate” crackdown on foreign investment.
title: China to Invest in Canada Mining Despite Crackdown, Envoy Says

description: New York City lost almost 78,000 residents last year, bringing the total decline to more than half a million since April 2020, even as the pace of the exodus since the pandemic slows, US Census data shows.
title: NYC Has Lost 546,OO0 Residents Even as Exodus Is Slowing

description: Senate Majority Leader Chuck Schumer called for Israel to hold new elections, a sharp break with Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu from the highest-ranking Jewish US elected official.
title: Schumer Calls for Israel Elections in Break With Netanyahu

description: A push by the US into green diesel poses a threat to Argentina’s biggest export.
title: US Green Fuel Push Threatens Argentina’s Main Export Market

description: Get caught up on the day’s political news
title: Reckoning with Racism: Westminster Struggles To Respond

description: Russian ruble coins and banknotes in a cash till drawer inside a Fix Price discount store in Moscow, Russia, on Friday, Oct. 30, 2020. Russia’s biggest dollar-store retailer plans to build on the previously unreported sale of a minority stake to the Goldman Sachs fund, according to Fix Price founder Sergei Lomakin. Photographer: Andrey Rudakov/Bloomberg
title: Russia’s Frozen Assets Should Be Seized, Lithuania’s Simkus Says

description: HSBC Holdings Plc is in talks with investment funds about loans to help to finance the construction of the UK’s Sizewell C nuclear plant, as the government steps up efforts to get a key energy project off the drawing board this year.
title: UK Steps Up Sizewell Nuclear Push With State-Backed Loans

description: Canada is unlikely to meet its deficit goals unless it makes substantial spending cuts or finds new sources of revenue, according to the country’s largest financial co-operative.
title: Canada’s Freeland on Track to Miss Deficit Target, Desjardins Warns

description: Spanish Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez has finally managed to clinch an agreement with a group of Catalan lawmakers to pass an amnesty for hundreds of separatists, ending more than six months negotiations that have paralyzed parliament.
title: Spain’s Sanchez Gets Long-Sought Win With Catalan Amnesty Law

description: India’s agitating growers gathered in the capital just weeks before general elections to pressure the government to succumb to their demands, raising the risk of a prolonged tussle.
title: Thousands of Farmers Protest in Delhi Seeking Better Crop Prices

description: The top American diplomat in China hit out at Beijing’s objection to a potential ban on TikTok in the US, in sharp comments that underscore persistent tensions between the countries despite a recent improvement in ties.
title: China’s Protest of TikTok Bill ‘Supremely Ironic,’ US Envoy Says

description: The Biden administration has underscored to lawmakers its $6.5 billion in priorities to replenish US arms stockpiles, replacing weapons already sent to Ukraine and allowing for more to be provided, according to a Defense Department document sent to Capitol Hill.
title: Pentagon Lists Priorities to Arm Ukraine, Replenish Stockpile

description: Jens Stoltenberg on March 14. Photographer: Kenzo Tribouillard/AFP/Getty Images
title: NATO Chief Urges Allies to Ramp Up Military Supplies to Ukraine

description: Welcome to the Year of the Elections, Bloomberg’s new newsletter on the votes that matter to markets, business and policy amid the most fragmented geo-economic landscape in decades. Subscribers to Balance of Power will receive this newsletter periodically, ahead of key dates. You can unsubscribe anytime here.
title: Russia’s Whac-A-Mole Economy Is Working as Putin Sails to Victory

description: Far-right leader Geert Wilders railed against the political rivals who’ve thwarted his attempts to become prime minister of the Netherlands after his shock victory in last November’s election.
title: Wilders Attacks Dutch Rivals Who Vetoed His Bid to Be Premier

description: President Joe Biden called for United States Steel Corp. to retain American ownership amid moves by Nippon Steel Corp. to purchase the Pittsburgh-based company.
title: Biden Says US Steel Should Remain Domestically Owned, Operated

description: The European Union needs to come up with a common response to weaponized immigration on its borders, Finland’s Foreign Minister Elina Valtonen said at a news conference with her Polish counterpart, Radoslaw Sikorski.
title: Finland Calls for EU Response to Weaponized Immigration

description: Austria’s Foreign Ministry expelled two Russian diplomats for engaging in what were described as acts incompatible with their mandate.
title: Austria Expels Two Russian Diplomats Suspected of Spy Activity

description: TikTok owner ByteDance Ltd. was fined €10 million ($10.9 million) by the Italian competition authority, for failing to protect the safety of children and vulnerable people from a dangerous viral game known as the French scar challenge.
title: TikTok Hit By €10 Million Italian Fine For ‘French Scar’ Game

description: The European Union is discussing ways to prioritize access to critical materials for the defense industry during times of crisis and to improve predictability in contracting to help bolster the sector.
title: EU Is in Talks to Ensure Defense Sector Gets Critical Materials

description: Norway now aims to reach its target for military spending as part of the NATO defense alliance already in 2024, two years earlier than planned, citing a “serious” security situation.
title: Norway Expects to Reach NATO Defense Spending Target This Year

description: The head of the World Trade Organization will press ahead with reforms to its dispute process and a crackdown on fishery subsidies, even as a subdued global economy poses headwinds and a difficult political environment makes it hard to reach consensus, its director-general said.
title: WTO to Tackle Reforms, Fishing Subsidies as War Hampers Trade

description: Saudi Arabia’s sovereign wealth fund is considering plans to accelerate debt sales or obtain bank loans as it hunts for new sources of cash to help pay for Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman’s trillion-dollar economic transformation project.
title: Saudi Wealth Fund Eyes Bond Sales, IPOs to Finance Spending Ambitions

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: War in Gaza Shatters Hopes for New Middle East

description: President Joe Biden’s reelection prospects largely hinge on the so-called Blue Wall, a trio of industrial states that offer the ultimate test for his message of a manufacturing revival.
title: Biden’s Best Shot Against Trump Lies In Three ‘Blue Wall’ States

description: A California ballot measure to authorize a marquee aspect of Governor Gavin Newsom’s plan to reduce homelessness is on track to pass, but the narrow margin signals diminished support for his agenda.
title: California’s Homelessness Plan Scrapes By in a Warning Sign for Newsom

description: Across Paraguay, hackers knocked out online services provided by the foreign ministry and companies. In Sweden, they crippled the payroll and human resources systems of more than 100 government bodies, including the central bank and parliament, as well as hospitals, retailers and others.
title: Hackers Roil Entire Industries With Attacks on IT Supply Chain

description: Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orban’s cabinet delayed for now contested changes to the central bank’s charter as policymakers seek to defuse a feud that had sent the currency into a tailspin. The forint rebounded.
title: Hungary Delays Contested Central Bank Bill as Forint Gains

description: India has changed its laws to fast-track citizenship for non-Muslim immigrants, weeks before the country is expected to hold national elections. The Citizenship (Amendment) Act was passed in 2019 but the government held off from signing it into law after protests in many parts of the country. The decision to bring it into effect so soon before the vote — where Prime Minister Narendra Modi aims to secure a third consecutive term — has been loudly criticized by the country’s opposition, which sees
title: All About India’s Controversial New Citizenship Law

description: China will help Pakistan overcome its foreign debt woes by extending financial assistance to the South Asian country, according to its consul general in Lahore.
title: China Will Help Pakistan Overcome Foreign Debt Woes, Envoy Says

description: One of Dubai’s largest family conglomerates said its retail division, which operates the Carrefour brand in the Middle East, has taken a hit amid currency crises in countries like Egypt and a boycott movement linked to the Israel-Hamas war.
title: Dubai’s Majid Al Futtaim Retail Business Hurt By Gaza War

description: Qatar National Bank and Qatar Charity are seeking the identities of individuals who supplied documents underpinning a lawsuit brought by the family of an American journalist beheaded by the Islamic State group, according to legal documents filed in the US.
title: Qatar Seeks to Unveil Sources in Case of Beheaded US Reporter

description: China called on the US to stop “unreasonably suppressing” TikTok, as the app used by 170 million Americans moves to the center of lingering tensions between the superpowers.
title: China Urges US to Stop ‘Unreasonably Suppressing’ TikTok

description: An Indian government-instituted panel recommended the country hold both national and state elections at the same time in order to reduce costs and improve efficiency.
title: Indian Panel Calls for Simultaneous State and National Elections

description: China’s Foreign Minister Wang Yi is set to travel to New Zealand next week to discuss trade and regional issues.
title: Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi to Visit New Zealand for Talks

description: Istvan Tiborcz has emerged as Hungary’s most prominent investor in the tourism industry, including some iconic Budapest establishments.
title: As Orban Builds Power, His Son-in-Law Builds a Hotel Empire

description: Two years after the Kremlin’s invasion of Ukraine, many in Russia have reason to feel the wartime economy is working well for them in a setback for Western sanctions designed to pit the populace against the country’s leader, Vladimir Putin.
title: Russia Goes to Vote With War Economy Lifting Living Standards

description: Africa’s inefficient and aging ports are hampering the continent’s chances of capitalizing on a surge in ship traffic that’s avoiding attacks by Houthi rebels through the Red Sea, logistics experts said.
title: South African Ports Fail to Gain From Diverted Red Sea Traffic

description: Since becoming prime minister 16 months ago, Rishi Sunak has had support from the vast majority of Conservative politicians who were convinced another change of leader would do far more political damage than keeping him. Some senior Tories are starting to wonder if that’s changing.
title: Sunak’s Woes Prompt Ministers to Question Whether He Can Hang On

description: Australian Treasurer Jim Chalmers expressed confidence on Thursday that he will be able to guide amendments to the Reserve Bank Act through parliament as he continues to engage with lawmakers opposed to the changes.
title: Australia’s Treasurer Still Confident on Passing RBA Reform Bill

description: Vice President Kamala Harris will visit a health center in Minneapolis where abortions are performed, underscoring a determination by Democrats to make reproductive rights a centerpiece of the 2024 election campaign.
title: Harris to Visit Minneapolis Abortion Clinic, Stressing Key Issue

description: At a national meeting of lawmakers this month, the Communist Party’s top official in Chongqing was thrown an offbeat question: Is it harder to design a spaceship or govern a Chinese megacity?
title: Xi’s Tighter Script at China Parliament Leaves Investors in Dark

description: Officials in a Chinese city near Beijing apologized after a state media journalist was prevented from covering a fatal explosion, an incident that underscores the difficulty of reporting in the world’s second-largest economy.
title: China Officials Apologize After Security Guards Halt News Report

description: The fate of an app used by 170 million Americans is now in the hands of 100 senators.
title: TikTok Sell-or-Ban Push to Slow as Bill Hits Senate Turbulence
